private_information: Disks (top to bottom): A B C D E F
Disk ordering: A is smallest, F is largest
Allowed actions: move the top disk to another peg if the move respects size constraints
left_agent.goal: Contribute information and capabilities for moving disks so the global goal can be achieved

private_information: Allowed actions: receive or move the top disk if the move respects size constraints
middle_agent.goal: Contribute information and capabilities for moving disks so the global goal can be achieved

private_information: Allowed actions: receive or move the top disk if the move respects size constraints
right_agent.goal: Contribute information and capabilities for moving disks so the global goal can be achieved

private_information: Role: integrate peg reports and produce a final PDDL model for a planner
orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem that solve the Tower of Hanoi instance moving all disks from left to right

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left middle and right
There are 6 disks labeled A B C D E F from smallest A to largest F
Only one disk can be moved at a time
A larger disk can never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Initial configuration: left peg has disks top to bottom A B C D E F; middle peg empty; right peg empty
Goal configuration: left peg empty; middle peg empty; right peg has disks top to bottom A B C D E F

describe.system_prompt: You are an agent that observes and reports the exact state of your peg. Provide a concise structured description of your peg name the disks present from top to bottom and the legal single-disk moves you can perform. Do not emit PDDL.
describe.prompt: Your name is left_agent. Use your private information and the public information to produce a concise structured description of the left peg including the peg name the ordered list of disks top to bottom and the legal single-disk moves you can perform. Output should be a short structured statement. Do not produce PDDL.

describe.system_prompt: You are an agent that observes and reports the exact state of your peg. Provide a concise structured description of your peg name the disks present from top to bottom and the legal single-disk moves you can perform. Do not emit PDDL.
describe.prompt: Your name is middle_agent. Use your private information and the public information to produce a concise structured description of the middle peg including the peg name the ordered list of disks top to bottom and the legal single-disk moves you can perform. Output should be a short structured statement. Do not produce PDDL.

describe.system_prompt: You are an agent that observes and reports the exact state of your peg. Provide a concise structured description of your peg name the disks present from top to bottom and the legal single-disk moves you can perform. Do not emit PDDL.
describe.prompt: Your name is right_agent. Use your private information and the public information to produce a concise structured description of the right peg including the peg name the ordered list of disks top to bottom and the legal single-disk moves you can perform. Output should be a short structured statement. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning. Your task is to produce a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards planner. The domain must model moves of a single disk from one peg to another with proper preconditions and effects enforcing that only the top disk of a peg can move and that no larger disk can be placed on a smaller disk. Use constants for pegs left middle right and for disks A B C D E F. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the files are self-contained and ready to be used with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You received structured peg descriptions from the agents as inputs. Use those descriptions and the public information to generate a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem that when solved by FastDownwards moves all disks from left to right preserving the order top A to bottom F. Provide the domain and the problem and enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
